page.title: 11Horses and Riding 3
page.content: They are open every day from 7.30am and they cater for all ages. they have a staff of 2 full-time and 3 part-time workers and have 2 helpers for every 6 children out riding. They provide lessons for jumping, indoor riding and forest rides. They charge Â£2.50 for 30 minutes and Â£5 per hour. Their equipment includes jumps and a dry suface riding centre made of cut up rubber tyres, this is called pasada and proves very expensive. They own 2 tack rooms and can provide hard hats etc. for those who are new to the sport. Recently they have started live in riding holidays for children aged 8 to 18 years. Summer is obviously their busiest time and their horses, though worked hard, looked fit and well fed. Besides grass and hay they are fed oats, barley, bran, sugar beet and nuts.
